Job_Title: Director, Oil and Gas & Chemicals Industries
Job_Descriptions: Director, Oil and Gas & Chemicals Industries About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities The Industry Banker is responsible for contributing to origination and providing industry expertise on deals. The Industry Banker will bring origination and product execution capabilities in order to focus on strategic deals (Corporate Finance and Capital Markets). Industry banker is responsible for engaging with clients on M&A, Financing and Capital Markets. The Industry Banker will work closely as a team with the Relationship Managers and Product Partners to deepen client relationships and drive revenue and returns growth. Energy sector as a whole is undergoing major transition with ESG and Decarbonisation driving the agenda. Our sector team is at the forefront of working with clients in the O&G Sector as they transition to a low carbon future. Singapore based sector team covers Asia Pacific and Middle East regions and is well regarded and has advised on some of the key transactions in the region. There is a healthy pipeline of mandates and the team is looking for a motivated individual to join a high performance team We are looking for a highly motivated individual with strong interest in the Energy landscape and Energy transition. Strong problem solving skills are a must and so is the ability to see the big picture with regards to sector trends. The individual will be expected to develop and generate new and innovative ideas for the clients across the bank's product suite Key Roles & Responsibilities Originate new mandates to help achieve the Industry Coverage annual budgets Develop strategic financing and M&A ideas for clients, taking the lead on the preparation of pitch-book materials Ensure mandates are properly and expediently executed to the highest standards Lead engagement with client, including deal economics, engagement letter and term sheet negotiations Position SCB's Industry Group as a first port of call for SCB's core clients requiring services in M&A advisory, LBO advisory, private equity placements, acquisition financing Initiate and develop new relationships with target clients and develop and maintain existing client relationships Work closely with Relationship Managers / Industry Bankers to up-tier key client relationships and help propagate an advisory culture in the wholesale bank Work closely with product partners in Corporate Finance, Capital Markets, Financial Markets and Transaction Banking to integrate and cross-sell products Leverage key lending relationships to win advisory and acquisition financing mandates Develop and manage talent of the Industries junior resource pool; encourage a performance driven culture Our Ideal Candidate Degree or post graduate qualified from a top-tier school Strong understanding and interest in the O&G sector, Energy transition and convergence sector 5+ years of M&A experience strongly preferred with understanding of Financing products Prior experience in a top-tier investment bank with a track record in Structured Debt, Project Finance, M&A, Capital Markets, Financial Markets or Structured Trade transactions Solid financial analysis, client interaction, deal negotiation and structuring Strong understanding of regulatory and compliance obligations Team player with ability to work across sector and product teams Strong work ethics, detail orientation and a passion for excellence Effective communication skills both written and oral with internal and external clients and stakeholders Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Remuneration shall commensurate with qualification and experience. Interested applicants, please apply online.

Hiring_Company: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Reporting to the International Division, you will be part of the team that manages MPA’s international relations and engages foreign authorities on pertinent issues in order to safeguard Singapore’s strategic maritime interests. What you will be working on You will manage MPA’s policies and strategies pertaining to this prong of MPA’s mission, develop and maintain MPA’s international, regional and bilateral relations with foreign counterparts, and enhance Singapore’s standing at various international and regional fora. The key duties and responsibilities are: -Recommending MPA’s response to international developments that can impact Singapore's strategic and commercial maritime interests. -Establishing strong working relations with maritime counterparts from other nations, particularly on areas of common interest. -Formulating policy positions and approaches to maritime issues, to enhance Singapore’s standing at various international and regional fora. -Representing Singapore/MPA at international and regional meetings such as IMO Council, ASEAN Maritime Transport Working Group, ReCAAP ISC Governing Council, Co-operative Mechanism on the Safety of Navigation and Environmental Protection in the Straits of Malacca and Singapore, Arctic Council, the Consultative Shipping Group (CSG). What we are looking for You should possess at least two years of relevant working experience in the International Relations or equivalent function. As the role involves the preservation of Singapore’s strategic maritime interests and overseas travel as a representative of the MPA, the job will favour candidates with strong analytical, writing and communications skills, and a good command of English.

Job Description : Do you want to help shape the future of healthcare? Our name, Siemens Healthineers (SHS), was selected to honor our people who dedicate their energy and passion to this cause. It reflects their pioneering spirit combined with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry. We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunity to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sounds interesting? Then come in and join our ASEAN team as Business Lead, Point-of-Care (POC) ASEAN to be responsible and accountable for the successful execution of the POC business strategy in ASEAN. The incumbent will be responsible to develop additional business opportunities and strategies in the ASEAN Zone. Your tasks and responsibilities: You will ensure the setting and achievement of monthly POC forecasts and yearly quota. Drive and achieve sales and CRM excellence including funnel management at each country level. Drive business partners management together with country leads across the zone to provide visibility on country's POC activities, opportunities and improve performance for POC. You are responsible to develop and implement effective Go-To-Market strategies relevant to each of the ASEAN Countries. Collaborate with key stakeholders including supporting functions to see through the GTM for each country. You will align with the Global Team and Asia Pacific (AP) to set, track, and achieve Country-specific targets across the Zone. You will manage the P&L and operational performance in all the countries, including managing the pricing, profitability as well as overall sales and marketing and SG&A expenses. You are responsible to engage and manage strategic KOL relationships drive the development and management of reference sites in ASEAN. You will assist and support the sales team through sales enablement initiatives and ensuring availability of necessary technical product training with the support of the AP Region and Global teams. To find out more about the specific business, have a look at https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/en-sg/point-of-care-testing Your qualifications and experiences: You hold a successfully completed Degree in medical lab technology/ life science/ biological sciences. You have at least 5 years relevant experience in a similar marketing role in IVD ideally in POC. You have Business Partners management and/or leading direct team experiences, ideally in IVD segment. Your personality and skills: You are skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a matrix organization. You have strong organizational and interpersonal and skills. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You are highly self-motivated and strong problem-solving skills. You enjoy working in a team environment, sensitive to cultural diversity and language level. This position covers the ASEAN region, understanding of the region and how business is conducted are essential qualities. You can travel up to 40% in the region (when travel becomes widely possible again). Our global team: Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company. 66,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services. Our culture: Our culture embraces different perspectives, open debate, and the will to challenge conventions. Change is a constant aspect of our work. We aspire to lead the change in our industry rather than just react to it. That's why we invite you to take on new challenges, test your ideas, and celebrate success. We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. We ask instead that you create a profile in our talent community where you can upload your CV. Setting up a profile lets us know you are interested in career opportunities with us and makes it easy for us to send you an alert when relevant positions become open. Click here (https://talent.siemens.com/stayconnected) to get started. To all recruitment agencies: Siemens Healthineers does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, employees or any other company location. Siemens Healthineers is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Organization: Siemens Healthineers Company: Siemens Healthcare Pte Ltd Experience Level: Experienced Professional Job Type: Full-time

Job_Title: #SGUT #SGUP Content Creation and Broadcast Manager (6-month contract) - Clementi
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Are you a creative person, able to inspire and brainstorm ideas to captivate target audiences? If so, we want you to be part of our team at the Singapore Police Force (SPF). The Singapore Police Force (SPF) plays a critical role in keeping Singapore safe and secure with our mission to prevent, deter and detect crime. Clementi Division is one of the seven Land Divisions in the SPF. It serves the community through a network of 4 Neighbourhood Police Centres (NPCs) and covers the estates of Jurong East, Clementi, Queenstown and parts of Bukit Merah and Bukit Timah. The Community Policing Unit (CPU) is a unit within the NPC which engages the community in building closer relations. CPU also leverages on social media such as Facebook and Instagram to reach out to members of public in educating them on crime prevention. As a Content Creation and Broadcast Manager, you will play an important role in creating effective crime prevention content and be involved in the social media campaigns from ideation to execution. What you will be working on We are looking for a pro-active and dynamic individual to be part of our team. You will be guided and provided with educational crime prevention content for content creation. You will be the social media content creator and provide guidance to the team by sharing ideas to assist with their content needs. You are also required to produce content within a stipulated timeframe, both with guidance and independently. What we are looking for REQUIREMENTS Strong knowledge of social media listening tools and analytics platforms; Creative and able to inspire and brainstorm ideas to captivate the target market; Able to produce valuable and engaging content; i.e. graphic content in the form of web, social media platforms etc; Strong in communication skills and a keen team player; Good time management and be able to meet tight deadlines; Prior knowledge in designing software or applications is an advantage; and Knowledge in video editing skills will be an added advantage. Note: Our officers may be deployed to frontline positions or have frequent interactions with members of the public. Candidates who are not fully vaccinated and do not intend to get vaccinated have higher risk of COVID complications and will not be considered for the position. To be part of our team, please submit an online application via www.careers.gov.sg. Short-listed candidates will be notified within two weeks after the closing date of applications.

What the role is The role of a Journalist in the Singapore Police Force (SPF) does not just encompass news reporting and writing. Your articles and publications will serve as an important piece of information to members of the public as it will not just help to present our operational capabilities to readers, but also humanise our Force to win the hearts and minds of the Singapore public. Your work will be vital in building trust in the SPF by presenting the professionalism of SPF and its officers. If you have a flair for writing and are passionate about instilling public confidence in our Force through your writing, then we want you to be part of the SPF’s Public Affairs Department (PAD). What you will be working on As a Journalist in the Editorial Unit of SPF’s PAD, you will cover developments in the Force or uncover human stories and write about them. You will be required to come up with innovative concepts and ideas for stories to be shared through articles and complemented with supporting photographs. This entails on-site coverage of major Police operations and events, which will be used to contribute to the timely production of our bi-monthly Police Life magazine (PLM). Apart from drafting articles for PLM, you will also need to co-ordinate with various units/departments on relevant information required for the SPF Annual. What we are looking for REQUIREMENTS Experience in Public Relations, Information Management and/or Mass Communication; Be a meticulous person with an eye for details; Have a strong command of the English language and some basic knowledge / interest in photography; Be proficient in Microsoft Office, Adobe Photoshop, Macintosh OS; Be conversant in both English and your second language; and Be a confident and eloquent communicator. Note: Our officers may be deployed to frontline positions or have frequent interactions with members of the public. Candidates who are not fully vaccinated and do not intend to get vaccinated have higher risk of COVID complications and will not be considered for the position. To be part of our team, please submit an online application via www.careers.gov.sg. Short-listed candidates will be notified within two weeks after the closing date of applications.

Job_Title: Senior Development Manager - Digital Business Services
Job_Descriptions: Senior Development Manager - Digital Business Services The health and safety of our employees and candidates is very important to us. Principal Responsibilities The role acts as the lead in eTrading Team on the GDM side covering the business on Rates and Credit, and will need to work closely with other technology teams in other regions to support Asia Responsible for Implementing new initiative for Fixed Income eTrading Gather requirement from business and create correspondent document for project Manage both local and global projects for Market growth initiatives including project delivery and support Analyse, design, implement and support new algo trading solutions Being part of the global team to implement and support mandatory upgrade Provide training to new and junior staff in eTrading and related areas Requirements At least 10 years’ experience with developing solutions for Fixed Income line of business Proven track record in delivering JAVA Core project and sustainable framework in trading environment Solid experience & Good understanding of Algo trading Very Strong understanding of ION Technologies – PXE/Market Making/EMS/Negotiation/Multi market spreader Familiar with Windows / Linux environment Solid experience & Understanding of trading activities and market data feeds Ability to multitask several ongoing issues. This involves the ability to assess priority and make appropriate decisions quickly and effectively Effective interpersonal skills and relationship-building skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with keen attention to detail Self-motivated and directed, with the ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required. You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC. www.hsbc.com/careers HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website. Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

Team Description and Purpose VMware maintains a large number of customer relationships through Enterprise License Agreements. These agreements entitle the customer to the use of specific VMware products according to restrictions on the deployment of these products which can include (but are not limited to): volume, geography, customer organisational structure. As VMware pivots from a perpetual license focused business to a SaaS focused business it is increasingly important to ensure that customers are deploying and consuming their VMware entitlements in an effective manner so that will they maintain and grow their investment in VMware in future renewal cycles. For this reason, VMware is investing in the creation of a Consumption Advisory Team with the goal of providing valuable insights to ELA customers, helping them maximise their investment with VMware in turn improving CSAT and encouraging business growth. Role Purpose The Consumption Advisory Representative will work with key accounts throughout the entire advisory journey. This includes introducing the concept and process to customers, working with them and relevant VMware stakeholders to gather and analyse the required data, finally, sharing this back to the customer in a manner that provides valuable insights and where required seeing the engagement through to transaction via the VMware Channel team. The required data will include contracts and corresponding licenses entitlements to be compared with deployment data provided by the customer including license key data. This will require engagement with the customer as well as other customer-facing account representatives from VMware to gather the data. Analysis of the data will require engagement with disparate VMware technical and analytical teams. Coordination between all parties to provide a seamless experience for the customer will be a key to success in the role. As this is a new team and function for VMware, there is an expectation that the Consumption Advisory Rep will be able to navigate ambiguities in the process and proactively take steps to optimise the process. Responsibilities Engage with customers to guide them through the process. Analysing of data sets, namely deployments versus entitlements per customer contract. Clarifying of ambiguities in deployment data versus contracts, engaging other teams where required. Presentation to the customer of the dashboard, provision on insights and identification of next steps. Handover to channel team for any transactions arising from a customer review. Bringing forward process improvement concepts. Skillset Customer-facing ability, including troubleshooting and presentation of data sets. Ability to manage through process ambiguity, clarify next steps and move forward. Ability to analyse data sets, understand and interpret contractual terms. Ability to build strong and cooperative relationships with field stakeholders. Cross-functional collaboration, particularly with remote teams on data analysis and transacting through channels. Critical assessment of processes, creativity to generate new ideas. Focus on customer experience. Potential KPI CSAT Examples of process improvement VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what's possible today at http://careers.vmware.com. Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Job_Title: Assistant Director/ Deputy Director, Integrated Facilities Management (Sports Hu
Job_Descriptions: What the role is At Sport Singapore, we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences. Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play, regardless of age, gender, race, ability or social status. It imparts life values, nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport. Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do. Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport, Strength through Teamwork and Care for People, we believe in working and playing, not just as a team, but as a family. What you will be working on Responsibilities You will be responsible for the overall site operations and management of Sports Hub facilities within the Kallang Alive precinct and NS Square, and ensure compliance with legislation, safety and statutory requirements for building and site operations. Your job include: Oversee the supervision of site team/ appointed contractors and vendors in the management of properties under our charge Perform facilities and maintenance management duties such as attending to fault reports, inspecting buildings, monitoring KPIs including imposing penalties, supervision and certification of works Perform contract and project management duties, including preparation of project scope, cost estimates, schedules, and specifications, procurement, evaluation and recommendation of vendors, supervision and certification of works for minor Addition & Alteration (A&A), Repair & Redecoration (R&R) and other projects works Manage the fault reporting system with building repair works, implementation of preventive and corrective programmes, etc. Implement preventive and corrective maintenance programmes including defect liability management (DLP) programme Provide IFM support for leasing and tenancy management duties, including handing/taking over of units. Ensure timely submission of regular management reports for facilities and maintenance management, budget planning and monitoring, expenditure, building audits, etc. Communicate and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders from management, internal business units, tenants, suppliers, contractors and partners Liaise and work closely with development team, multi-disciplinary consultants including architects, M&E engineer, structural engineer, etc. and construction team on land and building handover. What we are looking for Requirements We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service to stakeholders and the community. This individual should be a sport advocate through living an active lifestyle and staying active. In addition, an ideal candidate should possess the following; Relevant background and experience in Facilities Management, Property/Estate Management or Electrical/Mechanical Engineering. Fire Safety Manager (FSM) qualifications and/or Green Mark Facilities Manager (GMFM) certificate or equivalent is an added advantage At least 12 years of postgraduate professional and management working experience, preferably in supervising role on Integrated Facilities Management services Knowledge in government policies relating to procurement and infrastructure management Preferably with experience and involvement in land and building acquisition Applicants with public and private sector experience will be advantageous. Willing to start off as Project Hire leading to permanent placement Innovative and resourceful Good interpersonal skills Good problem-solving skills Strong advocate of active lifestyle The level of appointment will commensurate with applicant’s experience and track records. Successful candidates will be offered a termed contract in the first instance. Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Key responsibilities: You will be responsible for maintaining the DevOps Toolset with enterprise standard, supporting DevOps CI/CD platform and rolling out DevOps pipeline across business units as a centralized solution. The successful candidate will be a technically savvy, dynamic leader, excellent communicator, have demonstrable technical hand-on supporting CI/CD toolset coupled with excellent infrastructure knowledge and automation expertise. As part of a cross-functional product development group, you should be comfortable with working as part of highly talented teams ensuring that modern technology and process are utilised as part of the role. We’re looking for a hands engineer who will be: · Supporting and maintaining the entire DevOps platform and toolset. · Maintain the DevOps platform and toolset matching the enterprise standard. · Coordinate with the stakeholders from requirements gathering until successful implementation DevOps pipeline on boarding. Work with the vendors to setup centralized DevOps solutions considering market best practice, Industry standard and ease of support. · Work with the vendors to upgrade the DevOps tools farm and Integrating with tools. · Configuring SSO, SSL, Load Balancer, Auto Scaling and DNS setup for the DevOps Toolset with naming convention. · Lead analysis and resolution of root cause for Test Orchestration / Environment related issues Ability to multitask and work in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment Excellent written and oral communication skills; writing, publishing and conference-level presentation skills Stays current with industry trends and leads development of key DevOps, Runtime, and Operational innovation platforms. Able to solve infra related issues in tools like WebSphere, IBM Case manager, Datacap etc. Requirements: Must: Deep technical background, with hands-on experience in supporting CI/CD toolset (Bitbucket, Jenkins, Artifactory, Sonar, Veracode, JIRA and Confluence). Prior working experience installing, configuring, integrating, upgrading and patching CI/CD toolset. Prior experience is customizing JIRA and Setting up confluence spaces. Prior hand-on experience in setting up CI/CD pipeline as a centralized solution. Hand on experience in setting up DevOps governance, Security standards and audit requirements. Prior experience in setting up DevOps pipeline in internal and external could offerings. Experience with continuous testing, techniques and tools (Junit, Sonar Cube, Veracode etc.) Technical exposure of automation accomplished with advanced Python, Chef, Ruby and PowerShell Extensive experience in virtualization, cloud infrastructure and related technologies A strong passion for infrastructure as code and associated automation and provisioning tools Proven record of accomplishment of being results orientated with demonstrated ability to achieve aggressive goals. Excellent communication skills Should: Build relationships, obtain buy-in for proposed changes Evidenced delivery of complex projects Security concepts and what makes for a secure solution Analyzing, documenting and validating business requirements Ability to advice on industry standard tools for monitoring, alerting, configuration management and performance tuning Able to design a strategy and then execute against it Knowledge of WebSphere administration, Unix Commands, FileNet administration. Comfortable working in a challenging environment

Hiring_Company: Ministry Of Social And Family Development
Job_Title: Senior Executive/Executive (Resource Development and Management, PCRS, RPG)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Rehabilitation and Protection Group (RPG) provides services for the rehabilitation of adult and youth offenders and the protection of children and families. We are passionate and committed to making a difference in the lives of these children, youths and families and are looking for like-minded individuals who share the same passion as us to join our dynamic and life- changing team. As part of the RPG family, the Probation and Community Rehabilitation Service (PCRS) works to enable effective rehabilitation of offenders in the community. What you will be working on Reporting to Assistant Director (Resource Development and Management), he/she will perform work in the following areas to ensure the smooth running of the division thereby contributing to the effective rehabilitation of offenders on community-based Orders. He/She will also assist the organisation in other duties when required. 1) Administrative/ Corporate Services: Provide admin support for staff in the division (eg. workstations, laptop, access cards, etc); Ensure proper asset management in the division; Conduct regular audits on equipment issued to Probation Officers. 2) Finance Management: Assist in managing the financial resources for the division including preparation of annual budget estimates, attending to queries raised or submissions required on budget related matters, sharing of good financial management and control practices, and providing management with regular update of expenditure; Support the division in procurement matters. 3) Business Continuity Management (BCM): Maintain and update PCRS BCM plans; Operationalise the plans, when required. 4) Quality Assurance: Oversee to ensure the successful implementation and maintenance of the total quality system for compliance with the ISO 9001 requirements; Assist in appointing trained staff to carry out periodic audits on the quality system to ensure compliance with the ISO 9001 requirements; Assist to co-ordinate the management review of the quality system. What we are looking for Tertiary qualifications Good command of spoken and written English Understanding financial related matters such as procurement and tenders is an advantage Knowledge on quality assurance is desired but trainings will be provided Good interpersonal and communication skills Responsive and prompt in supporting various areas/ projects Good analytical and problem-solving skills and able to adapt quickly to evolving situations Is resourceful and can multi-task in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines

Job_Title: **NEW Full Stack Developer role - Highly Successful FinTech Firm - Singapore**
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Heather Allen Recruiter View profile & contact My client - a highly successfully fintech firm that is growing impressively YOY - are looking to hire a new Full-Stack Developer to join their firm! About the company: To be disclosed in greater detail upon interest Impressive AUM and growing 40-50% month on month! Have grown to 40 people in Singapore & currently opening offices in the USA Requirements: Ideally looking for someone with mid-level experience ~5-7 years of experience Any functional programming language is fine, it’s more important that you have a solid technical foundation with a strong understanding of software development best practices and coding standards. However, Node.js is a huge plus. Any experience with the following is a bonus; Node, typescript, golang, rust, react An active Github is great, especially if you don’t have much practical experience – send us the link or share details of any other interesting side-projects you’re involved in that we can help to highlight Incentives: Extremely exciting opportunity to step into an exciting fintech firm who are rapidly growing across teams and are doing extremely well. Flat structure with a “start-up” style culture and mentality – if you’re excited by joining a fast-paced firm where you can get exposure working on cool projects with the latest tech/tools this could be for you. For more opportunities, please visit our website at http://bahpartners.com/live-roles.

Associate Analyst - Sub - Sovereign The Role / Responsibilities: The key function of the role is to provide analytical, statistical, research and logistical assistance to credit rating analysts covering sovereign entities and multinational development banks. • Contribute to fundamental credit analyses related to sovereign entities and multinational development banks to help manage the team's portfolio of ratings • Support rating analysts in monitoring a portfolio of countries, forecasting macroeconomics and monitoring economic, fiscal and political developments • Contribute to credit-related thematic research • Develop, monitor and maintain analytical databases • Support credit rating analysts in: creating graphs, tables, spreadsheets and presentations, collecting and presenting data and comparative statistics, formulating ratios, preparing and retaining documentation, drafting rating committee memoranda and related documents, drafting research reports and special projects, as needed • Actively participate in internal credit discussions and meetings with external parties, including government officials and investors. • Assist managers and rating analysts with ongoing and ad hoc projects. • Adhere to all applicable codes of conduct, policies, procedures and best practices Qualifications: • Strong academic background - graduate degree or equivalent, preferably in Economics or International Relations; Finance, International Business and/or Public Administration may also be acceptable • Economic research or relevant Credit Research experience is desirable • 1+ years relevant experience in the Financial Sector, Government or Consulting; previous Macroeconomic Analysis experience • Strong knowledge of Macroeconomic Principles • Good quantitative skills • Financial/statistical research capabilities • Strong MS Office skills: principally Excel (including use of macros), Word, and PowerPoint • Excellent oral and written communications skills • Fluency in English is required; Proficiency in Chinese and/or Bahasa, beneficial • Strong attention to detail; Highly organised and efficient; Consistently meet tight deadlines; Proactive and exercise own initiative; Work effectively and contribute within a diverse team. Ratings & Research Support #LI-BW1 Moody's is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody's (NYSE: MCO) is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions. Our data, analytical solutions and insights help decision-makers identify opportunities and manage the risks of doing business with others. We believe that greater transparency, more informed decisions, and fair access to information open the door to shared progress. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody's combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com . At Moody's, we're taking action. We're hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We're educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity Moody's Investors Service is among the world's most respected and widely utilized sources for credit ratings and research. Our opinions and analysis on a broad range of credit obligors and obligations are valued around the world for their insight and rigor. At MIS, our workplace culture supports our mission to be the Agency of Choice for our customers, employees and future employees. Our Culture focuses on Excellence and embodies behavioral qualities such as Integrity, Responsiveness, Collaboration, Respect and Passion. Our people are our core asset and we look beyond outcomes to ensure that behaviors and interactions matter.

Job Description : Business Resiliency & Cyber Recovery Consultant Today, every organization needs to be digital, powered by data, running in a multi-cloud world, ready to take on anything. Our Consulting team assesses customer's strategic, organizational and business challenges and uses in-depth industry knowledge to offer technical solutions that apply to future business environment and operational objectives to help our Dell Technologies gain market share and increase efficiency. Join us as an Advisory Consultant on our Consulting team in Hong Kong to do the best work of your career and make a profound busines and social impact. What you'll achieve As a Business Resiliency & Cyber Recovery Advisory Consultant, you will provide consultative and technical delivery leadership on a wide range of complex client facing consulting engagements which will enable our customers to protect and maintain the availability of their most critical business processes, applications, and digital assets. As a technical leader on the service delivery team, you will earn your clients trust through competence, expertise and partnership guiding them through advisory, planning, design and execution of high impact strategic business resiliency and cyber recovery initiatives. This position requires a dynamic individual with great customer facing skills to develop and articulate a broad range of business resiliency strategies and solutions to meet the customer's strategic business and IT transformation goals. You will be working closely with the Planners and Architects to plan HDB towns to be self-sufficient with a work-live-play-learn environment, where all towns have a comprehensive range of amenities and facilities to cater to the different needs of our residents, offer opportunities for residents to interact and add to the vibrancy of the towns. Job_Title: Deputy Director / Centre for Animal Rehabilitation (Animal Rehabilitation & Prog
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Animal & Veterinary Service (AVS), a cluster of NParks, safeguards the health and welfare of animals through comprehensive and integrated programmes and works closely with partners in the veterinary and animal-related industries to strengthen capacities and enhance competencies in animal health and welfare. It is the main touch-point on animal and veterinary matters in Singapore and the first responder for all animal-related feedback. It also conducts public education and engagement programmes to foster a humane and gracious society for all, where pet owners, communities, and animals co-exist in greater harmony within our City in Nature. What you will be working on Oversight and supervision of programmes to support animal welfare and animal behaviour science, e.g. canine rehabilitation and animal assisted activities (AAA) programmes, including planning and budgeting, procurement, process review, management of inventory and contract services, data management and analysis, facility maintenance, workplace health and safety, compliance with ISO and SOPs. Plan and oversee research projects Lead a team including animal behaviourists, researchers and temps, contract staff, interns and volunteers. Engage stakeholders such as Animal Welfare Groups, rehomers, trainers and the community. What we are looking for Degree in Psychology, Biological or Life Sciences, Veterinary Sciences or related fields preferred. At least 8 years of relevant experience in work areas related to animal related work or programmes Strong leadership and management skills, independent, self-motivated, positive, meticulous, task oriented and enthusiastic. Able to lead and work effectively with others in a team environment. Good written/ oral communication and interpersonal skills. Competent in Microsoft Office Applications. Job_Title: Sales Planning & Strategy Consultant- International DCS GBO
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : International DCS GBO Consultant As we grow Dell Technologies and its ground-breaking products and services, the further and faster we are helping drive human progress. Global Business Operations plays a key role in helping deliverthese outcomes.Through determiningkey strategic initiatives and supporting the development of long-term sales growth plans, this team enables us to deliver innovative tech to more customers than ever before. It's a far-reaching and varied field that includes developing and managing sales measurement models, examining our strategic priorities and identifying new areas of opportunity. From evaluating sales incentive plans to diagnosing sales force training needs, it's about improving both the quality and quantity of sales activities. Join us as a Sales Planning & Strategy Consultant in our InternationalISG GBO Organisation in Bangalore to progress your career, to workon interesting initiatives and to make a profound social impact. This role is part of the headquarters team helping drive the EMEA, APJ, GC & LA Pan ISG businesses. What you will achieve: As a Sales Planning and Strategy Consultant, you will get a great understanding of the Dell Technologies ISG business and how effectively we are setup to solve customer problems. You will help drive key strategic initiatives, and identify and evaluate sales growth opportunities designed to optimise outcomes. You will: .Establish a management system to identify opportunities and improve performance .Drive & operationalize transformation agenda of the business .Build, establish executive scorecards which help identify root cause of gaps in business performance .Manage KPIs across sales capacity, model investment cases with potential business growth .Drive rigour around transactional business - identify areas of efficiency gains around tools & processes .Drive and ensure uniformity of business KPIs across all regions wherever applicable . Coordinate communication and disseminate information to stakeholders . Evaluate and recommend strategic priorities, sales force performance metrics and sales effectiveness tracking methods Requirements for the role: . Bachelor's degree .10+ years of related experience (analytics, sales, operations & finance) . Advanced understanding of sales processes . Strong strategic& analytical competency . Excellent communication skills . Understand key salesreporting tools, advanced capabilities preferable . Strong project management skills . Self-starter & team player Here's our story now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We're proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What's most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn't stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what's next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 . Application closing date:10 December 2021 Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.
