DESCRIPTION Job summary Are you looking for a role that leverages both your analytical and creative abilities, giving you the opportunity to stretch into drafting strategic plans and collaborate with teams across multiple countries? A growing team of enthusiastic marketers who work hard but have even more fun? Look no further! Amazon is seeking a self-starter Marketing Manager to support the growth of its Retail business in Singapore. The candidate should have experience analyzing marketing campaigns and building relationships with internal stakeholders, driving campaigns optimization and results, and be comfortable managing multiple responsibilities within a fast-paced environment. A can-do, entrepreneurial attitude will be required to make the most of the systems we have in place to deliver against new customer acquisition, conversion and funnel optimization targets. The candidate will be tasked to test new ideas and concepts, gleaning insights from what worked (or didn't), and leveraging opportunities to scale based on results. The candidate will be required to prioritize effectively and to be able to identify and deliver optimization of resource usage with a view to reduce manual efforts and automate leveraging the Amazon scale, inventing new processes and simplifying existing ones. Above all, this person must be comfortable with ambiguity, working with stakeholders and supporting tight timelines. The Marketing Manager focus will be focused on: . Crafting and implementing strategies to optimize new customer acquisition, conversion, frequency and loyalty. . Drive acquisition and retention goals. Have a thorough understanding of customer metrics and create action plan to manage continuous improvement initiatives. . Create and drive roadmap for customer experience including usability studies, surveys, onsite promotions and A/B tests. . Analyzing campaign performance metrics, reporting on data and recommending areas for improvement. . Work with product team to develop and improve retail systems, personalization and automation of tasks. . Strong understanding of the e-commerce industry landscape to make recommendations to the business. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . Bachelor's degree . Min. 5 years of relevant experience in retail and/or marketing with a proven history of delivering results . Experience in merchandising. . Strong communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills that enable you to earn trust at all levels. . Business focused thinking, an ability to focus on key issues and a strong hands-on, results driven mentality. . Motivated self-starter who thrives on working in complex and challenging environments of a rapidly evolving business. . Analytical with a natural curiosity to measure, test, learn and iterate in order to get the best results possible. . Proficiency with Excel, strong written English and verbal communications skills with an innate attention to detail. . Demonstrated ability to work independently and autonomously. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . Previous e-commerce experience . Familiarity with databases and SQL. . Ability to analyze data quantitatively and use customer research, data and metrics to back up assumptions, identify opportunities, and assess the efficacy of merchandising programs. . Experience creating and/or improving operational processes across teams/stakeholders . Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results . Comfortable with a varied set of software and editing tools. . Ability to learn new tools quickly

Job_Title: Sr. Operation Program Manager, Global Manufacturing & Operation
Job_Descriptions: DESCRIPTION Job summary Do you know Amazon is also a leading company of consumer electronic devices? Started with Kindle e-reader, Amazon now have various product families of devices including Kindle, Echo, Fire tablets, Fire TV and lots more groundbreaking products. What will you help us create? Key job responsibilities This role has a combined responsibilities including project management, on-going reliability test Engineering and factory managed part supplier quality management for products we manufactured through a EMS partner. At high level the key job responsibilities are including: . Plan and execute the manufacturing of products in compliance with company goals and objectives, drive factory build readiness to support the product PDP schedule. . Being an onsite POC to lead and facilitate the communication cross functionally teams internally and externally with CM suppliers. . Implement specific validation items in on-going reliability test plans with schedule. Flexible adjustment should be made based on issue occurring and debugging. . Create reliability test plan to qualify factory process change, line move, line resume and copy lines. . Report on-going reliability execution progress, risk assessments and drive for issues closure. . Evaluate and develop reliability test methodologies/plan to reduce the cost (test time, sample etc) and increase the coverage. . Manage CM factory owned part supplier quality. . Manage the Materials In Line DPPM performance(LVRR). . Develop and deploy relevant tools and activities across the organization for continuous improvements BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . Bachelor's Degree in Engineering with Minimum ten (10) years program or factory operations experience in a manufacturing environment or working with contract manufacturing partners. . In depth knowledge and experiences in managing manufacturing operations and working with Contract Manufacturers . Excellent verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills - both in Mandarin and English . Proven track record implementing quality programs with spirit of continuous improvement . Ability to implement robust Corrective actions using 8D format. . Good vision, analytical, process oriented and strong problem solving skills. . Detailed knowledge of product development processes as well as a strong understanding of manufacturing processes . Good understanding of the principles and basic structures of measuring instruments such as HALT, chambers, oscilloscopes, and multi-meters etc. . Strong technical problem solving skills and experience with failure analysis techniques. . Familiarization with supplier auditing and development. . Experience on ISO9000/MSA, MIL1916/105E, ANSI, etc sampling plan, AQL implemented. . Able to use Minitab or any SPC tools to perform data analysis and interpret the result. . Experience of using Lean Six Sigma tools: Failure Mode & Effects Analysis (FMEA), Design of Experiment (DOE), Gage Repeatability & Reproducibility (GRR), Process Capability Index (CPK). PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . Experience in reliability or hardware test for electronic products . Experience in Design For Manufacturability (DFM) of products . Experience on working with suppliers and setting up process controls, data collection, failure analysis and corrective action . Experience with failure analysis techniques to isolate failure for any issues . Reliability knowledge, statistical knowledge and be able to use reliability and statistical method to do data analysis, provide product risk assessment and life forecast.

DESCRIPTION This role is a unique opportunity to work in some of the most cutting edge data centers in the world. Amazon data centers are large-scale high-density centers where you will be working on changing the face of Cloud technology in the region. A Data Center Failure Analysis Technician will work as part of the Operations team whose primary responsibility is the functional testing of components in a failure analysis environment within a data center. They may also be required to support the maintenance and upkeep of the data center infrastructure. As a Failure Analysis Technician you may be the primary point of contact for both internal customers such as Logistics, Data Center Operations, Data center managers. As well as external customers such as Hardware Vendors, Contractors, Service Providers among others. This is a full time position and working Monday to Friday but may require a shift based pattern, operating on a 24/7 rotation. The ideal candidate is someone with hands-on hardware experience. Responsibilities: . Work and meet SLA's against assigned trouble tickets via a directed workflow. . First line touch point for hardware troubleshooting and technical issues . Perform regular server hardware repairs(drives, motherboards etc). . Carry out routine network, server hardware and OS related repairs. . Work with cross-functional teams on a regular basis to complete routine work. . Engage with Smart Hands in EU Regional POPs. . Adhere to security and safety best practices in the data center. . Participate in Data Center power & cooling events. . Participate in team meetings for metric analysis and daily/weekly goals achievement. . Identify and help create documentation for use globally. . Identify and help create process improvements relevant to the data center environment. . Perform server upgrades, rebuilds, scheduled works as required. . Interact with third party vendors & contractors. . Contribute to the development of other team members. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS . 1+ years of technical experience. . Intermediate knowledge of computer hardware systems. . Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal . Ability to work well with others in a team environment, displaying excellent time management skills. . Ability to take direction from both a directed work system and/or a team lead. *This role has a physical component, requiring the ability to regularly lift and move certain heavy equipment. This will always be in accordance with applicable manual handling and safety guidelines. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS . Experience working on component failure analysis and functionality testing. . Basic knowledge of Linux is an advantage. . Basic knowledge of networking is an advantage.

Job_Title: Digital Bancassurance Product Manager - Digital Business, Global Consumer Financial Services
Job_Descriptions: Digital Bancassurance Product Manager - Digital Business, Global Consumer Financial Services The candidate being sought is to replace the product owner for Digital Banca in the Digital Business team. He / she should have strong domain knowledge of insurance as well as mobile and digital technologies and landscape. This has to be coupled with strong engagement and collaboration skills with product managers and partners. Roles & Responsibilities: - Execute strategy, roadmap and drive delivery of KPIs for Digital Bancassurance - Manage and track digital projects/capability delivery to Digital Bancassurance agenda covering all insurance products and platforms - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to bring design thinking into customer touchpoints - Document requirements and evaluate solutions to make necessary recommendations - Engage with insurance partners to foster collaboration and teamwork to meet the business objectives - Influence and drive industry initiatives in collaboration with Govtech, ABS, MAS - Conduct / manage user acceptance test, develop rollout plan and complete implementation activities - Support smooth rollout of enhancements, manage pre and post-implementation activities, train frontline teams and develop processes with operations teams - Work with IT/ops team to resolve issues and communicate progress - Show and tell to stakeholders Qualifications Requirements: - Possess university degree and > 8 years' of work experience in a insurance/ insurtech industry - Familiar with digital and mobile technologies development and digital bancassurance trends - Proven track record in online/mobile banking product development and SDLC - Strong hands-on experience in documenting user requirements, business analysis and user testing - Knowledge in Life and General insurance distribution - Strong attention to details and design thinking abilities - Can-do attitude, team player - Ability to build strong partnerships with internal business partners and inter-department associates - Work well under tight timeline and pressure and able to multi-task *LI-CL

Job_Title: Principal, Business development - South East Asia
Job_Descriptions: DESCRIPTION Job summary Amazon is currently seeking a Principal Business Development manager for South East Asia (SEA) to assist and enable large-scale strategic partnerships for our consumer subscription business in the region. In particular, this role will focus on supporting complex new business development channel for the distribution of Amazon services through mobile operators, Media companies, Wallets and Fin-tech companies. Managing this exciting and fast-growing portion of the Amazon business will provide the successful candidate with the opportunity to fulfil the Amazon motto to "Work Hard, have Fun, and make History." Key job responsibilities .Coordinate with internal stakeholder business teams to support definition and execution of a high impact strategy and plan for country and regional specific business development opportunities for Telecom and Media distribution companies. .Assist with all partner activity to source, contract liaison involving legal, operations and marketing teams .Lead all internal approvals and due diligence including strategic planning and document writing to ensure execution meet the needs of all stakeholders and is aligned with the business objectives. .Coordinate and align with relevant Amazon internal teams to leverage established relationships, present a unified vision to our partners and support partnerships that add significant value to the business overall. .Deliver business reviews to the senior leadership team with account updates and progress BASIC QUALIFICATIONS .Extensive knowledge and experience of the SEA telecom industry and Media marketplace .Strong, extensive experience leading end to end, complex, time sensitive strategic BD negotiations in a media, telco or other relevant environment. Strong experience managing partners at all stages of the funnel creation/identification of opportunity, term sheet, contracts, closure, launch and managing and growing the partnership post deal launch. .Strong communication, persuasion and advocacy skills. Ability to think, analyse, and react in a high energy, fast paced environment. Proven business judgement and influencing skills. .Good organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management and meeting deadlines. .A clear and concise communicator and writer. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS .Deep experience of working on complex entertainment distribution deals in the media / telco / other relevant sector. .Solid understanding of the entertainment marketplace and a passion for content. MBA from a top tier programme. .Strong track record of building and maintaining a network of relationships to help navigate complex situations and foster long term opportunities. Strong proven ability to deal with ambiguity. .Strong business judgement. Passion for big challenges, adaptable and a desire to continuously learn and grow. .Excellent strategic document writing skills.

What the role is The Fiscal Policy directorate of MOF is looking for a self-driven, highly motivated individual to join our team. The Fiscal Policy Directorate is responsible for overall fiscal policy and fiscal and strategic planning, comprising revenue, financing, expenditure planning and the shaping of the public policy agenda over the medium and long term. The Fiscal Policy Directorate is looking to transform its collection, management and analysis of data to shape Singapore’s fiscal strategies. As a member of the team, you will help to build up Singapore’s fiscal data systems and develop data-based products to support budgetary policies and inform fiscal decisions on maintaining macroeconomic stability, supporting economic growth, and promoting social equity. Key areas of work could involve the following: Designing fiscal data structures Managing the development of data systems Analysing data and developing data-based products to inform fiscal decisions Fiscal modelling and forecasting Reviewing fiscal and budgeting policies Shaping Government’s expenditure priorities Analysing fiscal impact and sustainability of policy changes and major public spending programmes The role offers a rare combination of opportunities – to engage in and build technical competencies in data science, while gaining a strategic overview of the government’s priorities and how it manages trade-offs among competing needs across the whole of government. It requires the jobholder to be rooted in deep technical knowledge, while being able to take a broad view, so as to design data products that add incisive insights for Singapore’s fiscal strategy. What you will be working on What we are looking for Candidates should preferably have: Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, as well as skills in data structure design and common programming languages . A background in Accounting, Computer Science, Data Science, Economics, Finance or IT System Design. Experience in IT system project management is a bonus.

What the role is The Economic Programmes Directorate in MOF works closely with economic agencies to strengthen Singapore’s economic competitiveness and advance Singapore’s interests as a key global node of technology, innovation and enterprise. We determine how resources (including grants, tax incentives, loans, equity, and other tools) are optimally allocated across economic programmes to realise value for Singapore, including good growth and job creation. We also formulate policies to nurture a pro-business and trusted business environment which is conducive for business renewal and growth. In addition, we conduct data analysis on the business environment and firms’ needs and work closely with IRAS to build functional leadership on broad-based disbursements to businesses. What you will be working on What we are looking for You will be part of a dynamic and collegial team that shapes and funds national priorities around economic recovery and transformation. Examples of areas that the team looks at are as follows: 1. Strategising, managing, prioritising, and allocating Singapore’s investments in economic development to realise maximum outcomes for Singapore from our economic budget. 2. Enabling and aligning economic agencies (e.g. MTI family, MOE, MOM, NRF, NCCS, IMDA) in economic development, in areas ranging from investment promotion, growing local firms, to upskilling/reskilling workers, and strengthening our innovation ecosystem. Policy areas include productivity, internationalisation, Research, Innovation and Enterprise initiatives, digitalisation, jobs and skills, and climate change mitigation/carbon pricing. 3. Spearheading strategic partnership with private sector players in equity financing and project financing, to support Singapore-based companies to scale up. 4. Harnessing multiple levers to advance Singapore’s interests and positioning as a global business centre, e.g. policy innovation, financing approaches, legislation, regulatory frameworks, and strategic partnerships.

What the role is The Fiscal Policy directorate of MOF is looking for a self-driven, highly motivated individual to join our team. The Fiscal Policy Directorate is responsible for overall fiscal policy and fiscal and strategic planning, comprising revenue, financing, expenditure planning and the shaping of the public policy agenda over the medium and long term. As a member of the team, you will help to formulate Singapore’s fiscal strategies to maintain macroeconomic stability, support economic growth, and promote social equity. Key areas of work could involve the following: Fiscal modelling and forecasting Reviews of fiscal and budgeting policies Shaping Government’s expenditure priorities Analysis of fiscal impact and sustainability of policy changes and major public spending programmes Formulating revenue and financing policies The role offers a strategic overview of the government’s priorities and strong exposure in managing trade-offs among competing needs across the whole of government. It requires the jobholder to consult widely at all levels, synthesise information effectively, generate robust options and exercise sound judgment over trade-offs. What you will be working on What we are looking for Candidates should preferably have: Strong critical thinking and analytical skills, as well as numeracy skills. A background in Economics, Finance, Accounting, Business or quantitative disciplines.

Job_Title: Account Manager, WW Public Sector, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: DESCRIPTION Job summary Amazon Web Services provides a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform in the cloud that powers more than a million businesses in 190 countries around the world. To meet the growing demand for AWS Services across the globe, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you have excellent organizational and communication skills, a passion for working in a fast paced, dynamic environment and a desire to deliver exceptional customer experiences, we'd like to speak with you! Here's your chance to join us as our Account Manager in our AWS Public Sector Singapore team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of AWS within the Public Sector market segments. The successful candidate will identify partnerships for collaboration and drive customer engagement to build a strong sales pipeline and strategic opportunities for assigned accounts. Key job responsibilities This individual should be able to develop and execute a territory sales business plan and be an exceptionally strong analytical thinker with IT sales experience. The candidate should have a successful track record of meeting sales targets and a passion for developing new accounts. Other responsibilities include: Develop long-term strategic partnerships in Public Sector customers. Shape and define goals and success metrics, ensuring alignment with the overall business strategy. Create and articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services with the Public Sector Assist customer in identifying use cases for priority adoption of Amazon Web Services and ensure they are successfully using our web services with the technical resources required. Formulate tactical plans with priorities to exceed revenue and strategic goals. Support the execution of the strategic business development plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. SA, Business Desk, Capture, Partner teams) Nurture opportunities and fill pipeline by active engagement with prospects, partners and key customers Prepare and give business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks to closing new customers. Understand the technical requirements of our customers and work closely with the internal development team to guide the direction of our product offerings for developers. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS The Account Manager will have significant domain expertise within the software technology industry. The ideal candidate will have a keen sense of ownership, drive and enthusiasm. Other requirements are: At least 10 years of experience handling territory breadth segment of public sector, education institutions, and nonprofit and associations in the Singapore market. Demonstrate achievements in managing sales and exceeding targets Good understanding of the Singapore Government procurement process and contract vehicles PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Positive, proactive problem solver and self-motivated with sense of urgency and follow-through Excellent communication and writing skills

Associate Investments Lead Summary of the role: As an Associate Investments Lead, you will collaborate closely with a broad group of cross-functional teams and regional partner managers to identify, assess and evaluate, devise, structure and negotiate investments to accelerate deployment of open, shared network infrastructure. Introduction to the role: - The Position: Support the full lifecycle of infrastructure investments from opportunity assessment, business case development, due diligence, structuring, negotiation and execution. Support other members of the deal team, primarily but not exclusively through financial analysis and due diligence Develop financial models and valuation analyses including sensitivity analysis to support potential investment opportunities Participate in negotiations with prospective partners alongside other deal team members Assist in review of all legal documentation including debt financing, share purchase, shareholders agreements, and other ancillary documents Support the preparation and presentation of investment recommendations to internal stakeholders Work collaboratively with broad cross-functional partners such as Finance, Legal, Regulatory and Policy, to champion and drive execution of projects Assemble presentation materials and other written documentation in support of deal communications within Meta and for our external partners The Candidate: BA/BS or higher in economics / business, finance or equivalent experience Quantitative and economics analysis experience Financial modeling experience 3+ years of corporate finance experience, preferably with exposure to emerging markets Infrastructure-related investing experience, preferably in telecommunications sector Effective written and verbal communication skills We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified / contacted. For more information you can email Rena Chin in our Singapore office on rena.chin@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference Rena Chin 529520 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/VGk1iQ/associate-investments-lead-itcommunications-singapore-singapore-15076945 Job Reference: Rena Chin 529520 EA Reg No: R21102695, Rena Chin Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA License No. 10C4544

Job_Title: Asset Management Division, Global Client Business, Public Capital Market, Vice President, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Asset Management Division, Global Client Business, Public Capital Market, Vice President, Singapore AMD Asset Management Division (AMD) is one of the world's leading investment managers. AMD provides investment and advisory solutions that span a wide range of asset classes, industries, and geographies. We extend our investment capabilities to the world's leading pension plans, sovereign wealth funds, central banks, insurance companies, financial institutions, endowments, foundations, individuals and family offices. Public Capital Market (PCM) is a new role within the GS Asset Management Asia ex Japan Client Business. The PCM team is responsible for the design, development, and management of GSAM's product range to drive the AeJ Retail strategic growth agenda. The team also provides comprehensive research on product gaps and trends, thought leadership and competitive differentiation of GSAM's investment capabilities. Product Development & Product Strategy - PCM is responsible for leading the regional efforts and centrally managing the entire product development initiative and process. PCM will liaise with key stakeholders across the region, both internal and external. This includes assessment of the business opportunity, identifying potential pain points/risks/issues early and providing viable solutions to deliver a product in a timely manner. - To lead and/or facilitate strategic product development related initiatives with other cross functional partners and build product strategies to support GSAM's AeJ business needs, with a focus on Singapore and Hong Kong Retail and Asia Private Banking channels. - Work with AeJ Client Business Teams in identifying product gaps and opportunities, capitalizing on market and regulatory developments and trends. - Develop a strong and effective partnership with the Client Business teams and maintain understanding of market needs and provide solutions that meet commercial objectives in a timely manner. Product Execution and Governance - Responsible for the liaison with stakeholders including internal parties, external legal counsel and regulatory authorities, in respect of new fund registrations and product management matters. - Operate as a subject matter expert on new products, changes to existing products or newly introduced product features, to support AeJ distribution efforts. - Keep abreast of local regulatory and industry developments and upcoming changes to global product ranges, consequently assessing the impact to the local fund registration and distribution. - Adopt and enhance regional "best practices" on product governance processes. Qualifications - Senior VP with overall 15+ years of experience and relevant experience in asset management industry in a product development role. - In-depth working knowledge of Luxembourg SICAV products and the regulatory environment within the Asia Pacific ex Japan region, with a focus on Hong Kong and Singapore. Experience in covering multiple markets will be an advantage. - Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex matters in a concise and meaningful way. - Strong project management and stakeholder management skills; comfort with working across geography, time zones and functions to effectively lead or contribute in large workgroup settings. - Comfort with ambiguity and dynamically shifting priorities, timelines, and demands. - Experience of working in a fast paced, deadline driven environment. - Proven ability of reviewing and editing offering documents. - Bachelor's Degree, ideally with relevant professional qualifications such as CFA is a plus - Language competency - Fluency in written and spoken English. Fluency in Mandarin and/or Cantonese will be an advantage due to business needs.

Job Description : About Us Dell Technologies is at the forefront of driving the digital future. With the combined power of industry leaders: Dell, Dell EMC, Secureworks, Virtustream and VMware, we're committed to transforming lives with world-class technologies.Dell Technologies unites seven technology leaders - Dell, Dell EMC, Secureworks, Virtustream and VMware - in one company with the power to drive digital transformation and generate real results every day for the customers and people who partner with us. You . Have knowledge and experience with architecture of enterprise or cloud scale applications . Experience of whiteboarding complex concepts to a technical & business audience . Knowledge of Agile & Lean methodologies and how they contrast with legacy practices . Have an ability to collaborate and work interactively with our clients to ensure their successful deployment of VMWare Tanzu . Have an ability to empathize with co-workers and clients . Are technically curious with the appetite to learn and master emerging technologies . Are coachable and willing to learn in order to adapt to a changing environment Us There is a paradigm shift towards cloud-native technologies and methodologies calling for new capabilities. As part of Dell Technologies, this initiative focuses on uplifting the Cloud Native Ecosystem in Singapore and enabling our enterprise customers in Singapore and the regional economies. Your Day . Provide technical direction for the development, design of Cloud Native architectures, standards, and implementation approaches and systems integration for client engagement and product/ solution development from definition phase through implementation. . Demonstrate leadership in IT management by producing strategic and innovative concept proposals, papers, and speaking at conferences. . Easily recognize system deficiencies and implement effective solutions. . Communicate and enforce best practices for building and running applications on VMWare Tanzu . Continually seeks opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships. . Manages client interactions and expectations regarding architectures. . Mentor junior architects to take responsibility for their development within the company. . Organizing tech talks and participating in meetups/events. Required Skills / Experiences . Experienced Software Enterprise Architect with demonstrated skills in designing PaaS solutions, enterprise middleware and Java Spring microservices based mission-critical applications . Understands complex enterprise, cloud-based concepts and effectively employs different design techniques. . Understands the benefits and ideal uses of various programming languages. . Communicates effectively with clients to identify needs and evaluate alternative technical solutions. . [1] Experience with database (e.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, MSSQL) and messaging middleware technologies (e.g. RabbitMQ) . A clear understanding of cloud service and deployment models . Has a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive customer interest in VMWare technologies . Excellent communication skills, both written and oral . Willing to travel and work on-site with customers and partners Desired Skills / Experiences . 8+ years of experience as an enterprise architect. . Experience with various public clouds would be an advantage . Experience with Kubernetes would be an advantage

about the company Our client is a well-established financial institution that focuses on the acquisition of structured finance / project finance loans in the market. about the job To provide credit risk opinions, credit reviews and credit analysis support by looking at potential structured finance / project finance deals for acquisition. Ongoing credit portfolio monitoring and portfolio management on existing transactions, highlighting any potential credit issues, if any. To follow up on credit-related requests, such as processing of waiver or consent requests, and etc. Prepare management reports on the portfolios for internal/external stakeholders about the manager / team Part of a lean, fast-growing and committed organisation, this role reports into the Head of Risk. skills & experience required Bachelor's Degree in Accountancy, Business, Banking & Finance, or related. Brings with you 5+ years of audit experience within the financial services team, or a solid credit risk or credit analysis experience in a corporate banking environment handling complex transactions Prior exposure to structured finance and/or project finance transaction an advantage Strong communication skills. To apply online, please click on the appropriate link. Alternatively please contact Adeline Lim on 6517 1629 for a confidential discussion EA: 94C3609/R1105572

Job Description : Displays and Client Peripherals PMO is responsible for end to end program management of Dell Peripherals from concept incubation, product development, sustaining and product end of life. Dell peripherals products include displays, webcam keyboards, mice, active stylus, headsets, speakers, docking station, video adapters, power companions, displays arms & stands and gaming keyboards, mice and headsets. Project Manager is responsible for Ecosystem interlock with Client's program team. Co-work with marketing to define Peripheral Offer. Lead development schedule discussion with ODM vendors. Device sample allocation plan for market seedings, engineering compatibility testing. Lead cross core team initiatives. Key Responsibilities Facilitate and/or participate in program/project extended and core team meetings. Create and maintain the cross-functional development and supporting schedules. Create investigative schedules for exploring launch options. Work with suppliers to lock project schedule and track milestones during development. Participate in project reviews as required to ensure project is on track Create and maintain hardware allocation tracking with suppliers and work with the Hardware Library to facilitate sample distribution. Work with the cross-functional extended team to plan allocations, track deliverables, and understand vendor build and materials plans. Work with platform teams across LOBs to ensure that peripherals are tied with systems for bundle sales. Ensure all Engineering Change Request and Engineering Change Order are submitted for pilot and production, conduct necessary ECO reviews, and track all ECOs to ensure cut-in on schedule. Ensure all project documentation is kept up to date and communicated to the team on a timely basis. Create and maintain project Bill of Material (BOM), including all required part numbers, Kits, etc. Conduct and participate in BOM audits to ensure accuracy. Requirements Degree in engineering, business, supply chain and operations management. Minimum 8 years of relevant experience Ability to work with cross-functional teams and varying levels of management. Collaboration and communication skills. Problem solving and quantitative analytical skills. Flexibility to quickly adapt to new challenges and operate in periods of ambiguity. Demonstrate attentiveness to quality and productivity. MS Project, Power BI experience, proficient in Excel.

Job_Title: VP, Java Backend Engineer (API), Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (WD31241)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Job Description At DBS, customer experience is at the forefront of everything we do. To help us build functional systems that improve customer experience we are now looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer. The person will be responsible for deploying API Gateway updates, identifying production issues and implementing integrations that meet our customers' needs. If you have a solid background in software engineering and are familiar with Ruby or Python, we'd love to speak with you. Objectives of this Role 10+ years of experience in building software applications focusing on backend development Building and setting up new development tools and infrastructure Understanding the needs of stakeholders and conveying this to developers Working on ways to automate and improve development and release processes Testing and examining code written by others and analyzing results Ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats Identifying technical problems and developing software updates and 'fixes' Working with software developers and software engineers to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended Planning out projects and being involved in project management decisions Responsibilities Deploy updates and fixes Provide Level 3 technical support Build tools to reduce occurrences of errors and improve customer experience Develop software to integrate with internal back-end systems Perform root cause analysis for production errors Investigate and resolve technical issues Develop scripts to automate visualization Design procedures for system troubleshooting and maintenance Skills and Qualifications BSc in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field Experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar software engineering role Experience developing engineering applications for a large corporation Proficient with git and git workflows Good knowledge of Ruby or Python Working knowledge of databases and SQL Problem-solving attitude Collaborative team spirit Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job Reference #242094BR Your team You will be working in the Critical Infrastructure Services Operations Team to provide support of the Critical Infrastructure Cyber Vault environment, which leverages a diverse set of mission-critical platforms and provides significant opportunities to gain valuable experience in some of the latest technology platforms, and to support the team in the deployment and management of the environment. Your expertise • ideally 8+ years technical experience with Critical Infrastructure operations and automation to include: • comprehensive knowledge of Cyber Resilience and Recovery strategies in complex organizations • good understanding of Disaster Recovery methodologies and business continuity principles • excellent knowledge of VMWare is essential • deep understanding of the following Critical Infrastructure Platforms: o networks, Firewalls and Switches - preferably Juniper o storage solutions - Dell Data Domains and V-SAN o active Directory Services & DNS/DHCP, and Federation Services o understanding of PKI and Certificate management o privileged Access Management tools such as CyberArk o windows Server 2016, Red Hat Linux 6,7,8 and Solaris About us UBS is the world's largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors. With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, at UBS we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we're more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact? Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. Employees working from UBS Singapore offices must comply with Workforce Vaccination Measures as implemented by the Singapore government with effect from 1 January 2022, and other applicable safe management measures as may be amended from time to time.

What the role is What you will be working on What we are looking for Competencies have long been used as a framework to help focus employees' behaviour on things that matter most and help us drive success. We are looking for candidates with the following competencies:

Job Description : Internship (MBA) - Complexity Management (6 months) Everything in Dell Technologies is ground-breaking, from the designers of our products to the developers of our supply systems. The Global Operations (GO) organization within Dell drives the development, implementation and management of operations and suppliers in the delivery of strategic programs. We focus our resources on the continuous improvement of the movement of materials through production processes and establishing key performance metrics and benchmarks relating to supply chain planning and forecasting. The Complexity Management arm within GO is a team of in-house strategists working together with the business on strategic resource optimization and design-to-leverage initiatives. Work is typically organized around project-based engagements and you will be working with talents from various backgrounds, including but not limited to management consultants, research analysts, supply chain experts and marketing professionals. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We're proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What's most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn't stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what's next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030. Our new Singapore innovation center is a key part of Dell's vision - come join us and you'll get to use your skills to explore, research and build ground-breaking products and experiences where your ideas will make a tangible impact on our customers. Regardless of project category, whilst engaged on a project, the Supervisor is required to provide support, task direction and tracking of the assigned technicians, engineers and sub-contractors. This support will consist of administrative tasks, forecasting, planning, risk management, quality management, change order management, sub contract progress payment certification. What the role is We are looking for a highly self-motivated individual to join the Business Intelligence (BI) Team, who have passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve the many business domains that NEA offers. What you will be working on In this role, you would also be involved in inter-departmental projects, and be responsible for the following: Play a leading role in the Prototyping, Application and Creation of Prescriptive, Predictive and Analytical dashboards and models to support various departments and glean insights from data to make better data-driven decisions. These include (but are not limited to): o Identify opportunities for business intelligence and advanced analytics to improve NEA’s operations deployment in the field and decision making at the operations level, as well as enhance financial operation and treasury management o Conceptualise/ Apply/ Prototype new/ existing data models for use in NEA o Pilot the implementation of such models with departments to support their line of work o Operationalise data models (including change management) Drive engagement and develop finance transformation workstreams with use of business intelligence and advanced analytics Actualise use of business intelligence and advanced analytics solutions identified for each of the finance transformation workstreams Build competency in the use of business intelligence and advanced analytics to adopt the new finance operating model Work with relevant stakeholders to make available the required platform/tool to support use of advanced analytics solutions related to the new finance operating model Understand and work closely with stakeholders to implement innovative and new ways of working (e.g. processes, organisation structures, systems) and leveraging on BI in their work Support the usage of technology (e.g. R, Python) to automate data processing and ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) for departments Support in establishing and maintaining Data Structure and Data Governance Framework for NEA’s Business Intelligence System (BIS) Support enhancements to * Business Intelligence System (BIS). These include (but are not limited to): o Gather and understand business requirements from various departments o Design and prototype Dashboards o Operationalise Dashboards (including change management) with appointed vendor o Provide basic maintenance support for dashboards to various departments Support the development and implementation of outreach programmes and Community of Practice events. These are aimed to keep NEA staff informed of transformation efforts and drive the adoption of analytics while also encouraging and soliciting ideas from NEA officers Note: BIS is a dynamic business intelligence and analysis platform that provides an integrated view of cross-functional information across NEA. What we are looking for Job Requirements: At least 3 years of relevant experience in corporate finance, business analysis, financial planning & analysis, capital and investment management, or other related fields At least 5 years of experience in data sets preparation and building statistical models Strong working knowledge of financial modelling Excellent analytical, decision-making, and problem solving skills Highly self-motivated individual who is mature, independent, and resourceful with a drive to learn and master new technologies. Good written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams Prior knowledge or experience in implementing the use of BI visualisation tools (e.g. Qlik Sense, PowerBI, Tableau). Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.). Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Prior knowledge or experience in the following would be an advantage: o In the field of business process re-engineering (including tools like Lean Six Sigma) and/or systems o Using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets o One or more of the following languages such as C, C++, Java, JavaScript, etc o Working with and creating data architectures You will be working in a fast-paced and highly volatile environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment Applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Job_Title: Development Partner/ Senior Development Partner, Financing Ecosystem
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The role will involve monitoring, analysing, reviewing and enhancing existing Government financing schemes to ensure their effectiveness in meeting the financing demand of Singapore enterprises, in order to support their growth both domestically and overseas. What you will be working on You will be involved in the research and analysis that focuses on the monitoring and assessment of Singapore enterprises' state of access to financing, through extensive engagement with a wide range of public and private stakeholders. An understanding of Singapore's current financing landscape, knowledge of the success factors of key global financial hubs which Singapore can adopt/adapt is required. You will also be required to review and devise the division's overall strategies to enhance the financing ecosystem in Singapore, including through research and benchmarking of Singapore's financing landscape against other jurisdictions, and identifying emerging trends, business models and tools in the market. What we are looking for - Trained in Business, Economics or Finance, you should ideally have at least 5 years of relevant work experiences with the financial industry, such as banking and insurance, especially in areas such as SME financing, Trade Financing, Project Financing and Credit / Risk Assessment. - You should have a strong analytical mind with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Applicants will also be evaluated on their experience and interest to contribute to the public sector in an enterprise development role. - A strong ability to communicate and engage with both external and internal stakeholders is critical. You must be comfortable with writing up memos, policy papers and developing cohesive presentation slides.

Job_Title: Product Owner, Client Servicing, Standard Chartered nexus
Job_Descriptions: Product Owner, Client Servicing, Standard Chartered nexus About SC Ventures SC Ventures ("SCV") was established in 2018 with the purpose of "Rewiring the DNA in Banking" by bringing three distinct areas together: The eXellerator Lab, enabling innovation at large in the Bank by supporting intrapreneurs and their ideas, collaborating with fintech's through the SCV Fintech Bridge and engaging with clients and co-creation ideas. The Investment Fund ("Fund"), tasked to acquire minority stakes in fintech companies ("fintechs") whose technology has been successfully validated in the Group. Venture building, with the objective of exploring new business models ("ventures"), in the way it engages existing new customers and markets. There are c.65 team members (excluding individual ventures), including dedicated colleagues from the Group's support functions, based in Singapore, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Nairobi, London and San Francisco. About nexus nexus is a white label plug-and-play banking solution powered by Standard Chartered Bank. We take pride in redefining how we bank customers globally by digitally marrying ecosystems to banks. Our Banking-as-a-Service (BaaS) solution is the gateway that enables convenient access to financial services. We believe in challenging the status quo and thinking outside the box to deliver innovative solutions. Let's shape the future of banking together The Role Responsibilities About the role The candidate will oversee, manage and improve the operations, service quality and customer satisfaction of the outsourced contact centre along with the country contact center team. This role is a key factor in driving operations and guiding vendors to deliver a best in class experience to our customers, across multiple geographies. What will you be doing: As nexus Product Owner - Client Servicing, you will: Work closely with Senior Product Owners to deliver functional capabilities surrounding the Staff Assisted Channels (CRM) and Contact Centre. Write, refine and groom user stories, maintain product backlog and prioritise on an ongoing basis to build and deliver the product vision. Work closely with users and agile squads on initiation, implementation, and post implementation support. Instil and monitor periodical performance on Post Call Surveys (PCS), Client Satisfaction, Quality and other key operational metrics. Conduct periodic (monthly / quarterly) performance review of the contact center operations with the vendor. Conduct needs assessments and cost / benefit analyses. Identify and evaluate technological options for improving operations and customer experience. Regular review of the training materials along with in-house training team to ensure that they are up to date and aligned to the learning objectives. Work closely with the country operations team and the vendor on any service lapses and improvements. Create and Manage all the contact centre platform related documentation including functional requirements, training documents, user training etc Our Ideal Candidate What do you need to be successful in this role? 6 years of experience with understanding of Retail Banking products (Saving Accounts, Loans and Debit Cards). Good understanding of client / customer experience and trends that are emerging in the market. Prior experience in working as a Product Owner in Agile projects is essential. A certification will be an advantage. Experience in managing project documentation, such as user stories and test scenarios with collaboration tools such as Jira, Confluence, TraceHorizon. Knowledge of call center processes and systems (Avaya, Genesys, Twilio etc) Professional and technical knowledge from tracking emerging trends contact center operations management Technology Operational experience in customer engagement platform, COPC standards / service and operations management will be a bonus. We are also looking for: An individual who champions teamwork and active communication (listening, communicating and open to feedbacks) A meticulous and detail-oriented individual in defining scope, personas, epics, features, user stories and acceptance criteria A challenger who is not afraid to question status-quo and takes the initiatives to resolve problems. An independent, proactive and humble learner, who is open to seek and receive guidance/ feedbacks when needed. A relationship builder who has good stakeholder management skills. The nexus family is made up of a bunch of fun, hardworking and results-oriented individuals. Most importantly, nexaurs value teamwork, and we champion a respectful, open and trusting work environment. If you are interested to be part of the team in re-wiring the DNA of banking, join us today. #YesWeCanLAH Find out more about nexus and what we do at https://scventures.io/nexus/ Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Understand and analyze requirements to assist in development of technical design specification and translating design into process/program specifications. Taking lead of projects. Able to work with the customer product owner to prioritize project work and technical debt to ensure optimum use of technical resources. Manage customers' expectations. Ensuring quality in the development process and providing ongoing maintenance. Coach, train and mentor team members Ensure team members receive relevant training to complete their tasks. Responsible for clear communication (both written and verbal) with technical and non-technical contacts (internal and external) and all seniority levels. Maintaining a good relationship with the customer. Requirements 3 years of Scrum-Master experience At least 7 years of experience with substantial project work in software design & development, of which at least 3 years are in agile projects Enjoy working in a team and apply adaptive, servant leadership according to the different working scenarios Experience in developing solutions using appropriate platforms and system technologies such as enterprise database design, web and application server and network technologies Degree or Masters in Computer Science and Engineering Self-motivated with a positive "can-do" attitude, creative with excellent presentation, communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills including strong persuasive techniques. Ability to lead, develop and maintain respectful and trusting relationship; Proficient in written and spoken English Able to travel as required Prior exposure to agile development methodologies such as SCRUM and XP Programming or Kanban. Prior experience in using user stories to document requirements will be a plus Agile certifications in CSM, CSP, PSM, PPO or PMI-ACP. Project management certifications in PMP, CITPM or Prince2 will be an advantage Completed Projects with strong need for User Experience We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for our employees & customers and will require all prospective employees to be fully vaccinated.

Hiring_Company: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is HTX is looking for a suitable candidate with passion for fire safety and possesses fire safety engineering knowledge to support MHA in enhancing fire safety standards in Singapore. This is done through the provision of fire safety engineering related consultations, waiver applications, plan audits, fire and evacuation modelling studies and administration of the scheme for fire safety engineers. The job-holder will report to the Senior Assistant Director of the Fire Safety Department in SCDF. What you will be working on The job-holder will be responsible for the following: To review and process plans and reports involving fire safety engineering designs proposed by Fire Safety Engineers. To process waiver applications within the target response time. This includes presenting the waiver issues to the Waiver Committee and follow up on the outcome. To assist Branch Head in the annual registration of fire safety engineers, conduct of workshops with fire safety engineers and administration of the continuous professional development program for fire safety engineers. To assist Branch Head in the review of fire safety engineering codes and standards. To ensure effective provision of consultation services to Qualified Persons and Fire Safety Engineers on all fire safety matters within stipulated timeframe. To ensure that performance/output indicators for the plans approval, processing of waiver applications, auditing of plans and consultation process are met. To provide sound advice to department staff on all fire safety engineering related matters. To conduct fire and evacuation modelling for verification and validation of fire safety requirements. To provide lectures at conferences/seminars/courses to both SCDF staff and building professionals on all fire safety issues. What we are looking for Requirements Tertiary qualification in fire safety engineering. At least 5 years experience in fire safety engineering design. Knowledge in fire safety engineering modelling softwares, such as FDS and STEPS. Knowledge of the local Fire Code and Codes of Practices. Team player with strong attention to details.

Hiring_Company: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Job_Title: Fire Safety Researcher, Protective Security and Safety (PSS)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Do you have a passion for research work? Reporting to the Deputy Director PSS, the jobholder will be part of the team to develop the Fire Research Centre (FRC) in the Civil Defence Academy. Upon completion of the FRC, the jobholder will then manage and operate the FRC to conduct burn tests and fire safety related experiments. Results from these experiments would be used to amend the Fire Code for safer building design. What you will be working on The job-holder will be responsible for the following: Assist with the development of Fire Research Centre, including obtaining relevant accreditation for the Fire Research Centre, e.g. ISO/IEC 17025. Establish training and standard operating procedures, including preparation of proper documentation for test procedures for the Fire Research Centre. Drive fire safety engineering research work and conduct fire tests and/or computer fire modelling simulations to support the fire code. Develop practical applications from research to enhance fire safety. Monitor fires of special interest and determine trends to improve fire safety. Provide specialist support that can aid fire investigations or improve fire safety. Publish analysis reports for fires of special interest. Provide consultation to Singapore Civil Defence Force on fire test standards, especially regarding the testing of fire safety products and materials. Conduct presentations at seminars/conferences/courses on fire safety engineering research work. What we are looking for Job requirements Tertiary qualification in Science or Engineering, preferably in fire safety engineering. At least 5 years experience in fire safety, preferably in fire safety engineering. Knowledge of the local Fire Code and Codes of Practices. Knowledge in fire safety engineering modelling software. Team player with an inquisitive mindset.

Job_Title: Executive / Senior Executive, Schemes Operations Systems (Contract)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Financing Ecosystem Division drives and supports Enterprise Singapore’s efforts to grow Singapore companies by improving their access to financing. You will be part of a team to support robust processing and back-end operations of government financing schemes. What you will be working on Your job scope includes, but is not limited to the following: Performing user acceptance testing on a regular basis to ensure that the system is developed in accordance to requirements Engaging stakeholders to understand system requirements and propose possible solutions in terms of system design What we are looking for You must be comfortable working with complex IT system and conducting user acceptance testing. You will be required to work independently and must be reliable in following through on the work assigned to you. You should possess an inquiring and analytical mind and take pride in your work and constantly be looking out for better or different ways of doing things. An ideal candidate would possess the following experience and qualities: Background in Business, Finance or Computer Science. Meticulous and proficient in the process of user acceptance testing and be able to complete robust testing of test scripts within the given time frame. Experience in working with complex IT systems and Agile development projects is an added advantage Be an effective team player with good stakeholder management skills, meticulous in your work, with good numeracy, communication and writing skills.

Job_Title: Deputy Director, Tax & Multilateral Organisations Management
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Tax & Multilateral Organisations Management team supports ESG to enable our Singapore enterprises to gain access to financing and in-country connections. Organisations managed include the World Bank, the Asian Development Bank and the International Chamber of Commerce. The department also supports ESG's vision by developing and implementing tax policy to support Singapore's companies capability development, internationalisation, and to maintain Singapore's position as the leading trading hub in Asia. The team is responsible for: Reviewing the tax policies and guidelines, taking into account the changing business environment and needs of companies; Monitoring international tax developments; and Ensuring that the tax incentives deliver the intended policy outcomes. What you will be working on As Deputy Director, Tax & Multilateral Organisations, you will be responsible for leading a team of financial development professionals to: Cultivate the multilateral organisations Undertake joint initiatives Facilitate introductions to our local enterprises and monitor progress Achieve ESG's tax policy objectives through reviews of existing tax incentives Manage communication with key stakeholders (government agencies/ministries and industry partners) Oversee the scheme administration of ESG's tax incentives, including ensure relevant audit and reporting procedures are adhered to Stay attuned to international tax developments and assess the impact on Singapore companies Formulate ESG's position for the negotiation of Avoidance of Double taxation treaties with other countries What we are looking for Background in Tax, Accountancy or Economics, with at least 10 years of experience in tax and/or policy implementation. A background in tax advisory will be an added advantage. Able to work across the organisation to understand problem statements for the enterprise landscape and to suggest solutions Experienced in senior stakeholder management Possess good interpersonal, writing and communication skills Global mindset, enterprising and a team player

Are you ready to power the World's connections? If you don’t think you meet all of the criteria below but are still interested in the job, please apply.  Nobody checks every box - we’re looking for candidates that are particularly strong in a few areas, and have some interest and capabilities in others. About the role: At Kong, our Account Development team works closely with our partners in both Sales and Marketing to build fanatical customer enthusiasm around Kong. Account Development reps are responsible for identifying and qualifying new opportunities for our sales organization. We view our Account Development program as the best way to turbocharge a long and successful career in sales and view our Account Development Representatives (ADRs) as the next wave of Account Executives at Kong. To aid in this endeavor, we invest heavily in the training and development of our team. This includes a 2-week long sales bootcamp, weekly 1-1 mentorship, and global virtual group trainings. By joining our team, you are making an investment in yourself that will accelerate the rest of your sales career. Our ADRs gain an understanding of our product, community, who we sell to, why they care, and what makes us relevant. They learn how to generate a pipeline quickly and effectively as well as how to achieve a good discovery and qualification. The team is a crucial resource for sales teams across Kong to get great talent from. This helps us scale our teams, as well as ensure that we have a culture of meritocracy. Being an ADR, is often a first step to jump-starting a career in sales. At Kong, we have a culture that celebrates diversity, fosters growth and enablement, and ensures that we provide our ADRs with the tools and the confidence that they need to grow their careers. The ADR leadership team has a true understanding of where each ADR is at in their personal development process, and mentors and enables them to ensure that they have the means and opportunity to be considered for their next role. At Kong, we truly believe that if you want to earn your MBA in sales, this is the place to be. As a leadership team, we spend an exorbitant amount of time working in the trenches with our teams to help them fine hone their business and sales acumen and ramp them to productivity, success, and greater roles. Why should you want to work at Kong? Market Opportunity - We are on a quest to build a $10b+ software company over the next few years and need YOUR help! Technical Leadership - We are recognized as the leader in innovation in the connectivity space. Amazing Team & Culture - Come be a "Konger" and find out what we mean. Building Great Products - Learn why the world's largest companies love our tech! - Over 250m+ downloads of our open source API gateway!  Over 40k+ stars on Github between Kong API and Kong Insomnia! What you'll be doing: Your First 90 Days By the end of month 1, you will: Have met your new team and had fun playing with some new tools Become a part of the wider Kong family Have had a successful sales bootcamp training Have a good understanding of what makes Kong’s product offerings so special Understand how our Account Development, Marketing and Account Executive teams all work together By the end of month 2, you will: Be comfortable talking to clients on the phone about Kong Have worked with our Account Executive team on your first opportunity Have shadowed a ton of calls and practiced several role plays Started delivering your ramp quota By the end of month 3, you will: Know our sales funnel inside and out, and feel confident to add value to our sales org Show clear delivery of our sales methodologies Provide insights to both our Account Development and marketing organizations to help us to continue to iterate and improve Delivered against your ramp quota Role Overview & Key Responsibilities: Work with the Sales team to develop and inbound and outbound campaigns from idea-generation through to qualified call Develop strong sales and product knowledgeInteract with IT and business decision makers via telephone, video, LinkedIn and email Update lead and prospect activity in Salesforce to ensure effective lead management Set qualified introductory meetings for the Sales team Nurture early phase opportunities for future pipeline potential Exceed monthly and quarterly opportunity quota Build strong relationships with our marketing team and Account Executives, where we pull together to maximize the win for our businessInvest in your self-development, focusing on the skills and attributes that will make you successful in your core role and get you set for future success And any additional tasks required by manager What is a Konger? We are a group of makers, thinkers, and doers focused on helping today’s developers build tomorrow’s technology. Our teams work on the bleeding edge of API innovation to provide our users with a central nervous system for data and services. We put design at the heart of everything we do, and we’re relentlessly focused on creating beautiful experiences for our customers. That’s why technology companies, major banks, e-commerce innovators, and government agencies put Kong in front of their most important web applications. We believe in the power of Open Source and everything it stands for. That’s why developers around the world enthusiastically contribute on top of our open-source platform. We are passionate about solving challenges that will fundamentally shape the future of technology, and we’re looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you believe in taking ownership of your work, making an impact, and having fun along the way, we would love to talk to you. Kong Core Values: Be Inclusive. We work together from anywhere to achieve our common goals. Our differences make us stronger. Be Authentic. We are genuine, principled and confident without arrogance. Show respect and kindness, especially in tough moments. Be Relentlessly Resourceful. We work with purpose, obsession and grit. It takes muscle to do hard things and doing hard things build muscle. Be Customer Obsessed. We care. Customers are everything, we put them at the center of everything you do. We are all empowered to make an impact. Be Curious. We value ideas over hierarchy. Never accept the status quo. We make bold bets, fail, and learn everyday. There is always a way. Be an Owner. We are drivers not passengers and own the quality and outcomes of our work. About Kong: Kong creates software and managed services that connect APIs and microservices natively across and within clouds, Kubernetes, data centers and more using intelligent automation. Built on an open source core, Kong’s service connectivity platform enables digital innovation by allowing organizations to reliably and securely manage the full lifecycle of APIs and services for modern architectures, including microservices, serverless and service mesh. By providing developer teams with unprecedented architectural freedom, Kong accelerates innovation cycles, increases productivity, and seamlessly bridges legacy and modern systems and applications. For more information about Kong, please visit konghq.com or follow @thekonginc on Twitter.

What the role is Within the Industry Cluster group in ESG, you will be part of the team that drives industry growth of our Singapore economy and builds competitive Singapore companies internationally. What the role is The Innovation Eco-system Development team drives the effort to strengthen the ecosystem for Singapore enterprises to become more innovation-led. Job_Title: Development Partner, Food, Household and Electronics
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will be part of the Trade Division driving international trading for Singapore and enhancing Singapore as a global trading hub. The Division is involved in attracting global traders to manage their trading operations from Singapore, as well as supporting Singapore Wholesale Trade companies in their growth and capability development. What you will be working on You would be part of the Food, Household and Electronics team and would be in charge of a portfolio of companies which are primarily in food wholesale and distribution. You are expected to: a) Actively engage companies in this sector and attract global traders to base and grow their operations in Singapore; b) Be involved in projects to develop strategies and processes, to ensure that Singapore remains a conducive business environment for companies in this sector; and c) Help to develop the capabilities of Singapore food traders and assist these companies to internationalise. What we are looking for You should have 3-5 years of working experience in international business or business development, with an interest to contribute to the public service. Knowledge of, or prior experience in the Wholesale Trade sector would be viewed favourably.

Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will play a key role in deepening ESG’s understanding of the Singapore’s startup ecosystem through various data intelligence gathering and sense-making efforts. This is achieved mainly through the Startup SG Network (SSN), an online community of startups and ecosystem partners. Your role includes engagement of startups and partners to onboard them onto the platform, support in training of existing data model, and track and monitor the growth of the network. Additionally, you would be part of the team in identifying the needs of startups and the possible solutions that SSN can provide to address the needs. What you will be working on What we are looking for Minimally 2 years of working experience in the relevant areas of Data Science / Analytics or Communications Experience in startup-related work would be advantageous Good communication and partner engagement skills Good team player with the ability to work independently Familiar with Excel and SQL and is comfortable handling large amount of data Experience with product development or Agile framework is a plus

Job_Title: Development Partner / Senior Development Partner, Transport & Logistics
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will be part of a dynamic team, empowered to groom a portfolio of Singapore-based companies within the sector of Transport and Logistics. What you will be working on - Manage strategic relationships at the senior executive & decision-making level, - Research & develop deep understanding of global & competitive trends that affect the sector & the resulting business opportunities, so as to provide valuable knowledge input to the companies, - Develop & execute sectoral strategies & company's growth plans, which includes identifying project leads, project analysis & facilitations, business missions & industry events. What we are looking for You should have 2-5 years of working experience in business development &/or business consulting in the transport and logistics sector (including sea and air transport). You should be results-oriented, able to demonstrate strong business acumen and strategic thinking. Excellent communications skills and the ability to perform under pressure & in a collaborative environment will put you in good stead. You must be comfortable with writing papers for this role.
